Delusion.description: I fear being perceived as incompetent, stemming from recurring nightmares and experiences of high pressure during grad school.
I believe I must handle everything alone and cannot rely on others, which contributes to my feelings of isolation.

Delusion.topic: Fear of negative judgment from coworkers
Delusion.description: I ruminate on the possibility that my coworkers think negatively of me, leading to anxiety and decreased self-esteem.
I feel a constant need to meet others' expectations to avoid frustration or disappointment, both personally and professionally.
My relationship with my father and unmet expectations during childhood contribute to deeply held beliefs about failure and inadequacy.
During depressive episodes, I feel my work is ineffective and lacks impact, reinforcing feelings of incompetence and failure.
I avoid directly discussing my feelings with colleagues, instead focusing on emotionally reassuring others.
I frequently experience nightmares about being unprepared for a thesis defense or being criticized by coworkers, reflecting my underlying anxieties.
